par.text: Silicon was discovered and isolated by the Swedish chemist Jöns Jacob Berzelius in 1823. Silicon is a metalloid. There are two allotropic forms of silicon: amorphous and crystalline. Amorphous silicon is a brown powder. Crystalline silicon is very hard, but rather brittle, diamond-like in structure. Silicon is a semi-conductor.
